subject: Plax, Plax, Plax
event:
Oy.

Accidentally shooting yourself in the leg while dancing at a nightclub?

This is not the recommended treatment for a bad hamstring.

And this is not how a New York Giant behaves, Plaxico.

You're not a Dallas Cowboy.

But you might be soon, if you keep up this kind of crap.

Thank god for Domenick Hixon.

comments.article:
Whaaaat?

Too ridiculous to true, and yet a quick look at ESPN shows that it is. Nutty.

(Nice dig at the Cowboys, too.)

I hate it when that happens.

Maybe that's why the Steelers didn't keep him around? It's not Steeler-ish behavior either.

Accidentally shooting yourself in the leg while dancing at a nightclub?

This is not the recommended treatment for a bad hamstring.

No, it totally is! He heard about it from a person at the soup kitchen he helped out at on Thanksgiving!

Or not. Never mind.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: facepalm
comments.article: WTF?

I'm from Pittsburgh and I have had the opportunity to party and drink with a number of the Steelers a number of times, Plax being one of them. He was an ass then and is an ass now.

For all his talent he is just another stereotypical wide reciever who thinks more of himself and less of his team which seems to becoming a fast growing trend. He left Pittsburgh without hesitation for the big bucks and bright lights even though he was one step away from the superbowl even then. He doesnt usually train with his teams and sometimes doesnt show up for practices. Transfer Lindell White's "I don't care" comment to PLax and it has become so typical of him that it would never even make a sound bite anymore.
Pardon my rant, but he's a dumb hick who doesn't give a damn about anything but himself.

The Giants are doing better without him anyhow. Just like they did without Shockey. Put him on the trading block and get what u can while u can in my opinion.


Go Steelers by the way :P

And here I thought that sort of behavior was mostly limited to the NBA, where you can usually get away with being a star player with no teamwork skills. But in the NFL? You are nothing without your team, and you need to respect that.
hahahahahahahahahahahahah

It could have been worse (at least for him)

[url="http://www.shortnews.com/start.cfm?id=67691"]OUCH[/url]

"Man Shoots Own Testicle During Attempted Robbery


Indiana: 25-year-old Derrick Kosch has been arrested and will likely be charged with armed robbery after a botched hold up finished with him putting a bullet through his right testicle and into his leg."
Don't forget about Steve Smith!  I love that guy!
Don't worry. With that kind of behavior, the Vikings are sure to sign him soon.
For 35 mil you guys can keep him George. I'll take T.O.s' antics with abilities over those of Plex's any day of the week :D With or without him I think you guys have a lock on the NFC East.
He's not a Dallas Cowboy, but he looks to be auditioning for a spot on the Bengals' roster.

comments.upictitle: I'd just yell out letters: pic#0
comments.article: Glad that these kinds of shenanigans would never happen on the Pats.
is that none of my rivals in fantasy football appear to have him in their starting lineup this week.
comments.subject: the real shame

comments.article: I dont have him starting cause he hasn't been putting up the points... but I'm droppin him RIGHT NOW
comments.subject: Re: the real shame

comments.article:
Exactly what possible reason did he give for having a gun in the nightclub in the first place?

This, along with the Black Friday incident on LI & the Toy*R*Us shooting in So CA just further prove that mankind is still nothing but a bunch of savages.

I guess he still hadn't "gotten it". Well let's hope this gives him a shot in the arm about what's truly important in his life like his son, family and profession.

Good news is that he should be back on the field in 4-6 weeks with a fully healed hamstring.
I'm beginning to think Plax is a bit of a punkass.
Yeah 'cause Lawrence Taylor set the bar so high in saintly behavior. ;)
comments.subject: Pfft

comments.article:
LT just wanted to play a little ball and snort a little blow. Plax is perpetrating like he doesn't need to answer to anyone about anything.

He's a young guy, he'll figure it out soon enough.

We need Tiki back. He retired way to early.
comments.subject: Re: Pfft

comments.article: Question. Why is a football player that makes millions a year carrying a f***ing gun around to a night club. Go back to Florida and make a rap album.

This is the purest form of darwinism haha. Im not a doctor or anything,i dont even play one on t.v., but a gun shot to the leg could end a career, millionaires who carry guns...i don't get it. That really sucks for your team but the guy seemed to be becoming more of a distraction than an asset...look at it this way the nature of the injury probably left the team some financial outs as far as his contract goes...could help in securing another wide out. bummer but hilarious...some people just cannot get out of their own way...if it wasn't so funny it'd be tragic.
comments.subject: bwahaha

comments.article: That's really idiotic & screwed up Plax had that happen to him.  It's sad -- he runs so wonderfully and now he'll be out for weeks.
That's why we (in Pittsburgh) let them have him.

Our Dallas Cowboys run on crack and cheap hookers! Don't mess with Texas baby! LOL!
Shazam!
comments.subject: C'mon George !

comments.article: I really hate to say it because he's so freaking talented, but come this off-season Plax may be another case of addition by subtraction, much like Jeremy Shockey.  And yes, thank god we have Dominant Hixon. :)  I'll also be curious to see if Sinorice Moss and/or Mario Manningham step up.

Would it be too much to ask for a "whoop whoop" from ya George for the Steelers smacking the Pats around And helping keep Mean Green in first??

People need to stop annointing Matt Cassell like he is Brady-esque.

Here we go Steelers!!

I'm waiting on that whoop whoop too, Mr Martin. :P

P.S.

I'm posting this with alot of the 4th quarter still left cuz the Steelers D is just that damn good.
comments.subject: Steelers punch the Pats in the mouth.....

comments.article:
Okay, here you go -- whoop, whoop.

Now beat the Cowboys for me, and I'll give you a whoop whoop de doo.
comments.subject: Re: Steelers punch the Pats in the mouth.....
Re: Steelers punch the Pats in the mouth.....

comments.article: "You're not a Dallas Cowboy." ...not yet, give it some time and we'll see. :)
comments.subject: not yet, anyway
